dict.string:
One year before college, I had this class called "Entrepreneurship". Our final project consisted in making a whole business model about anything we wanted. We would then compete with other classes for the best project.
By that time, I considered myself pretty good at Objective-C.
The best project would win a scholarship for a business incubator where we could have special courses and advisors to help us create our own company.

The project didn't really need us to make a physical product, but I wanted to test my skills, and we as a team decided to make an app.
A simple but really cool app about finding where to eat. The restaurants would then pay to be featured in the app.
I would program, and my two other friends would design the experience and plan the business model.
We were thrilled by it. We made an amazing job. My two other friends and I seemed to make a perfect app-making mix.
